name: AzureParallelDeploy
description: Minimize service deploy time by deploying multiple services to Azure Portal in parallel.
author: Stano Pe≈•ko

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select an Azure resource manager subscription for the deployment.

inputs.name: Services
inputs.label: Services
inputs.helpMarkDown: Logical name of the services, one name per line.

inputs.name: ResourceGroup
inputs.label: Resource group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Resource group name in Azure Portal.

inputs.name: ArtifactsPath
inputs.label: Artifacts path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Base path for services' source files. Service is deployed as ZIP file.

inputs.name: AppNameFormat
inputs.label: Format string for application name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Format string for creating app service name in Azure Portal. Format string accepts one parameter `{0}`, which will be replace by the logical name of the service. For example if format string is `prod-{0}-api` and logical service name is `forecast`, the service will be deployed to `prod-forecast-api` app service.

inputs.name: AppPathFormat
inputs.label: Format string for application source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Format string for path to source ZIP file for services. Every service is deployed as ZIP file. The format string accepts two parameters. Parameter `{0}` is replaced by artifacts path, parameter `{1}` is replaced by logical service name. For example if format string is `{0}/publish/Company.{1}.zip` and logical service name is `forecast`, deployed file path will be `.../publish/Company.forecast.zip`. The three dots will be the path set in *Artifacts path*.
